review_blob: Draught at Alibi Room, VancouverHazy amber color. A bit bready and cereally, good job with the malts, and the resiny hops are not bad too. Delicate and balanced. Not an ESB, but still a very good beer. A lot of character.

Draught at Alibi Room, VancouverHazy golden color. The aroma is fruity and flowery, pungent. The flavor mixes a sourish ipa with fruits and with booze, and they dont come along together very well. Resiny hops in the final, and quite some booze.Not a bad beer, but very chaotic.

Tasting at MattsDark amber color to brown, small frothy head. Mild aroma of vanilla, oak, toffee. Some caramel flavor, a bit thin, lack of depth, with some vegetables notes.Not the greatest base beer, not a necessary barrel aging; average.
beer_name: Boundary Bay Bootlegger Barrel Series: Scotch-style Ale - Oak Whiskey

review_blob: Tasting at MattsDark brown color, small frothy head. Mild aroma, but nice mix: dark malts, tobacco, oak. Moderate body strength, moderate sweetness; chocolate drink flavor, some oatmeal, a bit boozy, with bourbon touch.Uncomplex, a bit over the top, but not bad.
beer_name: Boundary Bay Bootlegger Barrel Series: Imperial Oatmeal Stout - Oak Whiskey

review_blob: Tasting at Matts; corkedDark brown color, small to no head. Along with the dark caramel, there is some glue in the aroma. Lean body, a bit boozy which explains why the sweetness level is moderate; dark caramel flavor, with hints of toffee, molasses, and some oak; boozy final.A bit over the top, not too exciting, but still quite good.
beer_name: Boundary Bay Bootlegger Barrel Series: Imperial Oatmeal Stout - Oak Bourbon

review_blob: Tasting at MattsDark amber color, almost brown, small frothy head. The aroma is rather nice, bourbon/oak, and a bit creamy; fresh wood. Round mouthfeel; the flavor is quite simple, caramel and toffee, mildly sweet, the hint of coffee is a downturn, the final is a bit woody.Messy, drinkable but I wouldnt get back to this again.
beer_name: Boundary Bay Bootlegger Barrel Series: Cabin Fever - Oak Whiskey

review_blob: Tasting at MattsDark amber color, no head. Sour aroma, the tequila gives celery; there is some wine and some vanilla. Very dry mouthfeel; very sour, the tequila gives a floral touch.Aggressive, nice.
Tasting at Eugenes, crowler from The Beer Junction, SeattleHazy golden color. Delicious fruity and juicy IIPA, sweet, more malty than hoppy.

Cloudy darker blond color, small to no head. Moderate acid aroma, some rubber, some citrus fruit, apricot, peach. Lean body, very dry, with low carbonation; The mouthfeel is dry, tart, a touch of apricot, a bit astringent in the final.Nice Sour.

6% ABVCloudy golden color, very small head, disappears quickly. The aroma is very tart, the citrusy fruit is very strong, there is a bit of vinegar, and hazelnuts. Very dry mouthfeel, the tartness is very nice, lemony, a bit astringent in the final; no evidence of peach.Aggressively nice sour beer.
Tasting at Eugenes, canCloudy blond color, small head. A bit citrusy, with spicy yeast, light residual sweetness, a bit astringent in the final.Dirty but nice.

Tasting at MattsHazy amber color. The aroma is bready, candy section of a small town grocery shop, some chemicals. Semi-dry mouthfeel; the flavor is a mix of candy caramel and vegetables, tomatoes; robust bitterness.A joke beer, so wrong

The color is dark, close to black, with small head. Convincing aroma, dark malts, a bit sour, chocolate, vanilla. Lean body; dark chocolate flavor, and strong sourness that reminds me of strawberries; rather dry; harmonious and powerful.Excellent.
Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamDark caramel, not roasty, a bit sweet, with some chocolate, bready. Pleasant.
beer_name: Black Raven Coco Jones Coconut Porter

review_blob: Tasting at Matts, canCloudy blond color, small head. Pungent hops in the aroma, fruity, some passion fruit, citrus fruits. Very dry mouthfeel; the flavor is a bit crackery and crisp, the hopping is very bitter, very piney, resiny, a bit dank.Very good.
Draught at Hops n Headz, Bellingham, WAAmber color, clean, with compact head. A Pale Ale with a zesty and spicy touch thanks to the rye and hops; smooth; solid, pretty good.
Tasting at EugenesCloudy amber color, dull, no head. Sweet and not very bitter drink, smells and tastes like old liquor, a bit fruity though, and very little bitterness.Old, but not bad.
beer_name: Big Sky Five Valleys Wheat Wine

review_blob: Draught at Brouwers Caf, SeattleCloudy amber color, small head. Nothing special in the aroma, actually some vegetables. Sweet mouthfeel, some malt and caramel flavor, quite good; less bitterness than expected, but juicy and fruity.Nice.
Draught at Columbia City Ale House, SeattleBlond color. The malt has a bit too much hay and husks, there are some grassy traces from the hop, its fairly dry.Not bad.

Tasting at Matts, canClean golden color. The aroma is very grainy; medium-dry mouthfeel, but the flavor too is quite grainy. Strong bitterness, some resiny and grassy hop qualities.Decent, but we dont feel the need of a time machine ;-)
Draught at Beveridge Place PubMahogany color, clean. It has a very good malt and caramel depth, moderately sweet, with nice fruity esters, and comforting alcohol warmth.Very good.

Draught at Brouwers Caf, SeattleRed amber color, hazy, no head. A lot of candied orange peel in the aroma, bergamot. Its sweet and undercarbonated; a lot of candied orange also in the flavor, and then the expected bitterness. And some marzipan.Its not a bad beer, but its really weird.
beer_name: Bainbridge Island Love of the Game

review_blob: Draught at Hops n Headz, Bellingham, WA, schoonerCloudy dark blond color with creamy head. Its a fruity Ale, peach and apricot, with a nice aroma bit simpler flavor, sweetish, a bit too muddy, and definitively not as bitter as expected. Pleasant, with no surprise.
Draught at The Local, Bellingham, WA, as Backwoods Nitro Stout, 6.2% ABVBlack color. Creamy and milky, soft, with light roasted malts and roasted nuts.Simple.Nitro kills !!?
Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamBlond color. Nice fruity hop aroma, grassy, but its a bit lost in the flavor, mellow, fruity, not enough hoppy.
Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamGolden color. A good lean IPA with animal hops. Balanced, pleasant. Very nice.

Bottle from Birratrovo, ComoDark brown color, headless, seemingly quite flat. In the aroma I get some chemicals, even a note of acetone; dark chocolate, sour wine. The mouthfeel is basically flat, hence a bit oily; good body strength, some malt flavor, too earthy, and I would be happier without the hint of sweet liquorice; some red wine, and some booze. Confused, but quite good.To me, the dark chocolate and red wine dont go very well together.

Draught at Beveridge Place Pub, as Backwoods Joe Coffee StoutDark brown color, almost black. Nice aroma of coffee and dark bread. Lean mouthfeel, rather dry, but soft; it has a very nice flavor of dark bread, rye, and hints of coffee; appreciated because it never gets too ashy or roasty.Very nice.
Tasting at MattsDark blood color, barely any head. Deep fruity aroma, berry wine. Strong body, very nice juicy sour berries, astringent, very sour.Excellent beer.
Draught at Super Deli Mart, SeattleBlack color with brownish compact head. Very chocolatey, moderately sweet, with a nutty final, and traces of espresso chocolate.Very nice.

Draught at Schilling Cider House, Seattle; 6.8% ABVPale yellow color. Like the name says, it has some cinnamon and pear, but they are delicate; its semi-sweet, with just light cider qualities, low bitterness, and light astringency in the final, a touch of nuts too.Pleasant and refreshing.

Can from the Craft Beer Advent CalendarGolden color, clean. A bit too caramelly, but not too dark, with correct bitterness level, some hop resins, not much hop quality; midway between old and new style IPA, nice Ale, not as fresh, and not what expected from a Colorado brewery.

Draught at Hops n Headz, Bellingham, WACloudy golden color. Ginger beer, the finger being evident, semi-sweet, and a bit soapy, maybe spicy for the rye. Why would you barrel-age such thing???Heavy to drink.
beer_name: Aslan Ginger Rye - Whiskey Barrel Aged

review_blob: Draught at Brouwers Caf, SeattleCloudy orange blond color. Very nice aroma, oranges and pot, spicy too. Quite sweet; the malt is a bit too mild, nice juicy and orangey hopping.At the festival, this is the best aroma, but the flavor is too mellow.
Bottle at the breweryPale blond color. Very strong bourbon aroma. Quite sweet, with dominant bourbon flavor, balanced, with warming alcohol. Lightly lemony.Very nice.
Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamBlack color with generous tan head. The strong roasted malt blends well with the citrusy hops.Nice.
beer_name: 7 Seas Port Royal Export Style Stout

review_blob: Tasting at MattsClean golden color. The aroma is a bit puckery, the flavor is malty, sweet, a bit too much cereal but not as much as bad gluten-free beers, a bit astringent, and decently bitter.Not too bad for what it is.

Bottle from Brewery Creek; tagged 04/11/17Hazy golden color, small head. Mix of thousand fruits; lychee, mango, sour grapes, lemon; honey, sour; medium funky touch. Very dry, highly carbonated, delicate malt background, sour and astringent, grapefruit peel; nice bitterness level.Excellent fruity sour.

Tasting at MattsBrown color with barely any head. The aroma is sour and a bit earthy. Good body strength, caramel and malt flavor, balsamic, moderate sourness, some fruity touch, dark fruits, a bit too earthy.Nice.

Bottle from De Laurenti, Seattle, 12.99$Blond-golden color, clean, with small head. Very nice aroma, very close to a Lambic, less strong; funky yeast, moldy cellar walls. Dry and smooth mouthfeel; again a lot of yeast character, bitter grapefruit, and some astringency in the final; more fruity than most Gueuze, a bit like a young unblended Lambic.Excellent beer. Still, in Belgium they can brew beer with more depth at a fraction of the price, hence I give one point less.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamAmber color, clean. Caramel aroma and flavor, the hop doesnt seem to improve it. Caramelly brew.
beer_name: The Hop Concept Hll Melon & Blanc IPA

review_blob: Bottle from Brewery Creek, Vancouver, corkedif it was released in March 2013, its 2 years oldHazy amber color with creamy and persistent head. The aroma is very nice, more fruity than the usual American Barley Wine, adding a dimension; there is also a delicate Bourbon vanilla touch. Good body strength, moderate sweetness, but expect less thickness and sugars than usual; instead this Barley Wine has a remarkable spicy character, like rye; good bitterness level, the hop participates with some fruity resins, more was expected.Even if its a Barley Wine, I suspect it was better when fresher; good brew, a bit different, but not mind blowing.
beer_name: North Coast Class of 88 Barley Wine

review_blob: Bottle from Belmont Station, PortlandHazy golden color with compact head. Tropical and citrusy explosion, perfect pale malt canvas, balanced. Lean, with very moderate residual sweetness. When you can conceal bitterness and alcohol so skillfully, the result is a great beer.

Bottle from The Beer Junction, SeattleCloudy dark blond color with small head. Aroma of zesty citrus fruit, food body strength, some toffee flavor, very light residual sweetness, orange flavor, orange peel, strong bitterness.The orange is very artificial here, the result is not very pleasant.
beer_name: Green Flash Tangerine Soul Style IPA

review_blob: Draught at Mckays Taphouse, BellinghamDark amber color, with tan head; moderately sweet with a light apple presence and low bitterness, some caramel. Decent.

Draught at St. Augustines, Vancouver; 9.3% ABV, 414mlBlack color with medium sized tan head. Roasted malt is the dominant note, but its not ashy; notes of dark salty chocolate, roasted nuts and very light liquorice; good body strength, with limited residual sweetness. Pleasant alcohol warmth in the final.Straight forward Imperial Stout, no gimmicks, just simple pleasure; excellent.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverDark amber color, clean. Aroma of caramel, candies, orange peel. Good body strength, malt and caramel flavor with some toffee; strong bitterness, oily hops, bitter orange peel over all, resiny qualities.Caramelly brew, not too sweet, not sticky, well constructed. Excellent.

Can from the Craft Beer Advent CalendarCloudy red color, small white head. Strong disgusting aroma of cheese (Alpine toma). Soft mouthfeel, weak body, a bit sour, a hint of fruits, and some cheese again.Undrinkable, the smell is a barrier.
beer_name: Black Market Tradecraft Series: Cherry Sour

review_blob: Draught at St. Augustines, Vancouver; 414mlCloudy dark blond color, very small head. Wise choice of pale crackery malts provide a dry and palatable canvas for the hops; the hops bring a lot of qualities, resiny and piney first, a bit fruity, a bit dank (this may be the br>This is on par with a very good batch of Fat Tug, this is truly well made IPA.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverDark color, almost no head. The vinous character is strong, it has some pleasant residual sweetness, strong character from the wood, moderate acidity, and a nice tart and fruity touch from the cherries. The final is astringent, with a bit of acetone.Nice complex beer, pleasant all round. Despite the name, this is not a Lambic, its clearly a Dark Sour.
